N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 459.7 - Reimbursement

State Regulations
(a) Expenditures
made by social services officials for senior citizens center services pursuant
to this Part shall be subject to reimbursement at the rate of 50 per centum of
its expenditures after first deducting therefrom any Federal funds received or
to be received on account thereof, and any expenditures defrayed by private
contributions. Such reimbursement shall not exceed the annual title XX
allocation. (b) For the purpose of
this section, expenditures for administration of services for senior citizens
shall include expenditures for compensation of employees in connection with the
furnishing of such services, including but not limited to costs incurred for
pensions, Federal old age and survivors insurance and health insurance for such
employees; training programs for personnel; operation, maintenance and service
costs; and such other expenditures as equipment costs, depreciation and charges
and rental values as may be approved by the department. It shall not include
expenditures for capital costs except in the case of centers purchased or
leased from a nonprofit corporation, company or association. Such expenditures
shall include an allocable proportion of all operating costs of such centers as
may be approved by the department, including but not limited to the
expenditures enumerated in this subdivision and expenditures for amortization, interest and other financing costs of any mortgage loan made to such nonprofit
corporation, company or association. (c) Payment of State reimbursement and
advances shall be made to local fiscal officers as in the case of State
reimbursements for public assistance and care under other provisions of this
